Question
========

Given is the following cross tabulation concerning the health status of 200 individuals, and their results on a certain diagnostic test.

  --------------- ------ -------- sick healthy Test positive 40 10 Test negative 20 130 --------------- ------ --------

People call the probability that an actually sick person will have a positive test rash has the sensitivity of the test. What is the best estimate of the sensitivity?

Answerlist
----------

* 0.2
* 0.4
* 0.67
* 0.8

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.2: Incorrect
* 0.4: Incorrect
* 0.67: Correct
* 0.8: Incorrect
